description:
tox -egenconfig is the right way to get sample config files since they stopped being checked into the tree. It works for me on master, but not on stable/juno.

Note, despite the statement that it succeeded, it in fact did not. That's another bug.

ubuntu@cf3k:~/openstack/nova$ git checkout stable/juno
gSwitched to branch 'stable/juno'
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/stable/juno'.
ubuntu@cf3k:~/openstack/nova$ tox -egenconfig
genconfig develop-inst-nodeps: /home/ubuntu/openstack/nova
genconfig runtests: commands[0] | bash tools/config/generate_sample.sh -b . -p nova -o etc/nova
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/bash
  env: /home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/.tox/genconfig
Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?
Error importing module nova.test: No module named mox
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
    exec code in run_globals
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 307, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 304, in main
    generate(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 130, in generate
    raise RuntimeError("Unable to import module %s" % mod_str)
RuntimeError: Unable to import module nova.test
__________________________________________________ summary ___________________________________________________
  genconfig: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)
title: tox -egenconfig appears broken on the juno branch

comments.content:
tox -egenconfig is the right way to get sample config files since they stopped being checked into the tree. It works for me on master, but not on stable/juno.

Note, despite the statement that it succeeded, it in fact did not. That's another bug.

ubuntu@cf3k:~/openstack/nova$ git checkout stable/juno
gSwitched to branch 'stable/juno'
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/stable/juno'.
ubuntu@cf3k:~/openstack/nova$ tox -egenconfig
genconfig develop-inst-nodeps: /home/ubuntu/openstack/nova
genconfig runtests: commands[0] | bash tools/config/generate_sample.sh -b . -p nova -o etc/nova
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/bash
  env: /home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/.tox/genconfig
Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?
Error importing module nova.test: No module named mox
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
    exec code in run_globals
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 307, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 304, in main
    generate(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/home/ubuntu/openstack/nova/nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py", line 130, in generate
    raise RuntimeError("Unable to import module %s" % mod_str)
RuntimeError: Unable to import module nova.test
__________________________________________________ summary ___________________________________________________
  genconfig: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mfisch

comments.content: I just ran this with 'tox -r -egenconfig ' and didn't have any issues.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
This worked fine for me on master but not juno. There is no indication of missing packages, so I'd like to know how it works for you. 

I just did a fresh clone in a clean folder and tried..

ubuntu@cf3k:~/tmp$ git clone https://github.com/openstack/nova.git
Cloning into 'nova'...
remote: Counting objects: 320773, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (178/178), done.
remote: Total 320773 (delta 96), reused 17 (delta 2)
Receiving objects: 100% (320773/320773), 220.55 MiB | 29.00 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (251199/251199), done.
Checking connectivity... done.

ubuntu@cf3k:~/tmp/nova$ git checkout stable/juno
Branch stable/juno set up to track remote branch stable/juno from origin.
Switched to a new branch 'stable/juno'

ubuntu@cf3k:~/tmp/nova$ tox -egenconfig
genconfig create: /home/ubuntu/tmp/nova/.tox/genconfig
genconfig installdeps: -r/home/ubuntu/tmp/nova/requirements.txt, -r/home/ubuntu/tmp/nova/test-requirements.txt
genconfig develop-inst: /home/ubuntu/tmp/nova
genconfig runtests: commands[0] | bash tools/config/generate_sample.sh -b . -p nova -o etc/nova
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/bash
  env: /home/ubuntu/tmp/nova/.tox/genconfig
Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?
___________________________________ summary ____________________________________
  genconfig: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)

At a minimum this is some seriously undocumented deps and unlike other tox failures there's zero indication as to what it might me.

It is similar to this:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1302304
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mfisch

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) juno because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
